4428253/4388588/4476626.title: Cure for the Whooping-Cough
4428253/4388588/4476626.text:
Get a hair out of the head of a child whose father died before it was born and put a small rib of it on to a piece of bread and jam and give it to a child to eat. That child will never take the whooping cough.



Get ten pieces of knotted straw bury one of them. Then rub the other nine on the warts three times a day for three days. Then bury them and when they have rotted. The warts disappear.



The first hickup that comes say there goes one of them. when the second one comes say there goes two of them. if a third one comes say there goes three of them and the fourth one will never come

4742157/4740769/4780915.title: Local Cures - Hiccough
4742157/4740769/4780915.text:
1. Keep your mouth closed for a few minutes and do not breathe (Master G. Hill Cellbridge)



2. take seven or nine drops of water.3. Take a deep breath



4. To get a sudden fright



5. Put salt on tongue



6. Take a half a teaspoonful of Creadsoda in a half a teacupful of luke warm water.



7. Get a cup of cold water try to drink from far side



8. To eat a lump of sugar



9. Get a spoonful of sugar and put vinegar on it and swallow



10. Fill the mouth with Cold Water and stick your fingers in your ears as you swallow the water

4922318/4869561/4932089.title: Local Cures - Cure for Hiccough
4922318/4869561/4932089.text: Local "Cures"Cure for Hic-Coughthere are two cures for hic-cough (strongly believed still to be effective) in this district :-(1) If the sufferer is handed a drink of water without wishing for or asking for it he will be immediately cured.(2) If somebody frightens him or her there will be an immediate cure. this is generally  done by accusing the sufferer of having done something wrong. He (or she) will then get excited- The excitement is supposed to effect the cure.I have seen those two "cures" performed several times myself and they invariably proved effective.

4922108/4852800/4954833.title: Hiccup
4922108/4852800/4954833.text:
Hiccough.There lives a man in this district named Conn Guiney.  He used to get the hiccoughs very often.  One day he met a man who told him to swing off the rafters for a half an hour.  He did as he was told and it cured him.



Blackcurrant Jam is a cure for a sore throat.  You boil blackcurrant jam in water and drink the water.  This is a good cure.



Hiccough.If you had a hiccough, you should take nine mouthfuls of water.



Ulcers.If you had ulcers, eat egg shells.  This is supposed to cure them.



Pansies.Pansies are to be seen in some flower gardens.  They are a bluish sort of flower and some of them are yellow.  Old people say that pansies are a cure for heart trouble.  You get the pansies and boil them in a pot of water.  You let them draw in the water like tea. When drawn it can be taken.

Whitlow(1) Boiled onion and linseed meal poultice(2) Dip the whitlow frequently in the water in which potatoes have been boiled.



Toothache.(1) A strong sniff of whiskey taken through the nose gives relief.(2) Insert a plug of tobacco into the hole in the tooth.



Hiccoughs.(1) Take nine sips of water without drawing breath.(2) Sip water from the side of the container furthest from you.



Stomach Pains(1) A linseed meal poultice.(2) Apply heated pot-lids rolled in flannel to the stomach.

Cure for Hiccough No 82A person should stand erect with outstretched arms, while drinking  from a cup of tepid water held to his lips  by someone else. Drink as much as possible of it without stoppingMaud Lowry



Travelling Folk. No. I.Some years ago the tramps were very plentiful, but these last years most of them have died.The tramps which come mostly to our house come in big bands, sometimes two or three families together.They have asses and horses, and they make cans, porridges, artificial flowers, and they come and want to sell them.They also sell hair brushes, combs, mirrors, hair oil and other  small things like that, and for these they want bacon, and milk, bread and raw potatoes. Long ago, the gipsy-women used to knit for the women, but they do not do that now.The Mc Cann's  are the gipsie's which come mostly our district.Travelling folk still call at our home, but

4921698/4891058/5162376.text:
1.  Give a good start to the person who has them and they will go.  It is not easy to do this if the person who has them suspects what you are going to do.2.  Take a spoon of sugar.3.  Nine sups of water without breathing.4.  Drink a cup of water with your finger in your ears.5.  Think of where you were at the consecration the previous Sunday and they will go.6.  Drink nine sups of water out of a cup from the wrong side of the handle.



Drink a cup of water with a pinch of soda in it.



The old people say that singing in your ears means that a poor soul in purgatory is reminding you that he needs your prayers and they say that if you pray the singing will go.  The old people always say that when that singing is heard we should pray for the poor soul who has called us.

4921885/4898896/5189786.title: The Robins and the Daradaol
4921885/4898896/5189786.text:
When Our Lord was to be crucified the robins came and covered him with leaves so that the Jews would not find him. The Jews began to look for Him and the Daradaol (Dardaol) hearing them said:"He is over there covered with leaves by the robins."The Jews found Him.The daradaol is cursed. We are supposed to regard the robin above all the other birds.



It is held that the seventh consecutive son (no daughter in between) has the power of healing or curing.



A Prayer To Cure HiccoughTake three sips of water in honour of the Blessed Family
